steps.title: Filtering Data
steps.content:
Using Filters in Excel

Filters help you temporarily hide data that doesn't meet your criteria. Let's learn how to use them effectively.

Key Filter Operations:

  • Click column header → Data tab → Filter button (funnel icon)
  • Use checkboxes to select/deselect values
  • Clear filters to show all data again

Remember: Filtered-out rows aren't deleted - they're just hidden. You can always clear the filter to see all data again.

quiz.question: What happens to rows that don't meet your filter criteria?
options: They are hidden but still exist
They are moved to another sheet

steps.title: Removing Unnecessary Columns
steps.content:
Streamlining Your Dataset

Not all columns are necessary for analysis. Learning to remove irrelevant data helps keep your workbook focused and manageable.

To delete columns:

  1. Right-click column letter
  2. Select "Delete"
  3. Repeat for additional columns

Important: Before deleting columns, consider if you might need that data later. You can't undo column deletion after saving.

quiz.question: What is the best way to delete multiple columns that aren't next to each other?
options: Delete them one at a time
Hold Ctrl while selecting columns, then delete
Copy the data you want to keep to a new sheet

steps.title: Cleaning Error Fields
steps.content:
Finding and Fixing Data Errors

Clean data is crucial for accurate analysis. Let's learn how to identify and fix common data issues.

Steps to clean data:

  1. Use CTRL + A to select all the cells in your spreadsheet.
  2. Use Go To Special to find blank cells
  3. Use Find & Replace for text like "N/A"
  4. Sort data to spot obvious errors

steps.title: Sorting Data
steps.content:
Organizing Data with Sort

Sorting helps identify anomalies and organize data logically.

To sort data:

  1. Select all data (Ctrl + A)
  2. Data tab → Sort
  3. Choose column and sort order
  4. Check "My data has headers" if applicable

Pro Tip: Sort on multiple columns by adding levels in the Sort dialog box.
